response.message:
YES! Finally! 
Thanks.
Nice work. Definitely better overview.
Looks good!
Nice work!!!
I really enjoy the new layout.
Man this loks so wonderful! Good job \m/
Meanwhile, still no chat support for the mobile app. Good job on the profile re-design.
Great work, design team! I've been wanting to see this on SO for a while since you teased us with it on meta \o/
Did not know I helped ~74k people, directly or indirectly. Thumbs Up!!
It looks awesome! Nice work :)
It says I helped ~3.8M people... that seems a bit on the high side O.o
So cool!
Wow. Love it.
When I visted Skeet's page http://stackoverflow.com/users/22656/jon-skeet , I don't see his rarest silver and bronze badges. Why?
I like this a lot. Nice going!
ooooo I want one!
Looks Great

YOU"VE DONE IT! ITS BEEN ROLLED OUT TO ALL SITES! I LOVE YOU OMFG PLEASE HERE HAVE AN E-KISS IT IS BEAUTIFUL OMFg

~Registered User on SO
How does one link their SO Careers profile to their SO user page?  I have both, but the input in my SO profile for the Careers account is disabled.
The **Top posts** in my new profile page do render Math, but turn it invisible after rendering. Happens only there. Where to file the bug?
So much white space... Do you guys realize some people still use SE with a computer?
My 2 cents on this.... I think it could have been done a lot better.
Ooo… looks like it's time for the disparaging trolls jump in.   Cool.   I hate change.  Boo.  Put it back how it was.
Great work!
Is there a particular reason you cannot track your tag badge progress until you've earned 20k reputation?
Really greeeat work guys!

This looks great.

I agree with Tyler though. Mobile chat support would probably top my list of wanted updates.
Wow, the new design is cool!
It's cool.
Great and pretty much helpful than before..
The career profile link thing does not detect my profile correctly; other than that +1
The most important things in one dashboard. This is really great!
This is better than the old one.
This one is more amazing and neat
Loving the new design. Thanks.
Neat and Looks Good. xD
Looking so Professional.
New design looking good and neat.
nice look, thumbs up for designer and developers.
There are a few bugs. Do we just post those on Meta?
Big thanks to the SE staff and the community members that worked on the new features! This is the best thing ever.
Its supper. Move visible numbers and graph inspire more to stay more in SO.
@Athari, because he earns so many of each of them that they stop being rare..

Good work. It circumvented the knee-jerk of "bring back good 'ld days". Here are two issues I've noticed:
1) Even though it knows I have a SO Careers profile which I don't publish to the SO profile, on the Profile tab it offers me to discover SO Careers which is inconsistent.
2) Hey, c'mon -- cool designers, figging world and dinosaurs that fell in love. Not everyone is into your Github cult. People are using Bitbucket as well. Having changeable, which mostly makes sense for the two, code hosting is a good idea.
This is Cool ! ... Especially we now know how much impact our contribution to stackoverflow community has been ! :)
nice look with same functionality!
Cool !

I love the intent, I'm not in love with the implementation though.

I just feel I must point out that this "people reached" stat doesn't really account for how many people I've helped to reach with significant edits on other peoples posts.

Nothing on the site encourages the kind of significant edits that I enjoy making, which also bring in exponentially more views on most of the posts.

Please recognise significant edits better.
Nice work everyone.

@FrankDernoncourt The new layout takes up significantly more space than the old layout. Due to the increased number of sections, and the unchanged basic principle of design (add whitespace between elements to add readability), this means more overall whitespace. This is despite the fact that there is actually much *less* white "space" on screen than before.
This wouldn't have made my top 100 things that need improving.  It's probably nicer, but it doesn't help find answers to technical problems - and that's why I use SO.
I'm loving the new profile look!

The new profile view looks GREAT!!!
I like the new people reached and tracking to the next badge features.
Absolutely love the new profile, great work! The "next badge" feature is super fun... I'm already getting more active now I know I'm halfway to my first gold badge.

>>How many people have you helped?
>>“People Reached” is a new way to see just how much your efforts here matter.

What about reverse feature here? Few days ago I(as many of us)'ve got invitation to vote for moderators. A long list...

What about a feature "how she or he relates to me" to help me vote?
Great effort and great look. I really impressed very much.
Am lovin it...
I have been waiting for something like this very long time, it looks stunning! thanks :)
Loved it! <3
"catch Skeet" was definetly the best part lol
programmers.stackexchange.com doesn't seem to have these changes. Why?
Great Job!
new layout is awesome, I really liked
Good job. Next...maybe update the circa 1995 styling of the flair badges? ;)

I still think having two  (The Profile Page and Activity page) profiles might not be best idea.

Designers should always aim for Simplicity.

Also combining answers and questions together on profile page - is it good idea?

Someone interested only in answers needs to click additionally and go to activity page to check separate statistics on answers and questions.

Your word billion has the synonymous milliard and the fact you don’t use it causes problems in South America because there (and in France too!) “un billón” is a thousand times greater than your billion.
To make SO more engaging it just need a good Windows Phone app. A mobile site is not enough.
Have been waiting for this for so long. And finally the wait is over. Thanks :)
Keep it up. :)
The newest profile page on IE 11 breaks and doesn't look good..

I think this is cool. However, my math.SE activity page suggests that my next badge might be "Illuminator"  with 224 of 500 done. At the same time, it is *not* shown that I have a much closer target: "Reviewer" in the Low Quality Posts queue (215 of 250 done)
This really looks awesome. keep up the good work.
Neat and plain, easy to navigate.
